title: DirectObject Reference
extract: According to OWASP, a direct object reference occurs when a developer exposes a reference to an internal implementation object, such as a file, directory or database key. Without an access control check or other protection, attackers can manipulate these references to access unauthorized data.Nov 19, 2014
extract_html: According to OWASP, a direct object reference occurs when a developer exposes a reference to an internal implementation object, such as a file, directory or database key. Without an access control check or other protection, attackers can manipulate these references to access unauthorized data.Nov 19, 2014
